reviews.text: Wonderful restaurant
Too fire   !!!!
CÃ³mida deliciosa, ambiente muy agradable!
Kind of a strangely open dining room in the back but the food and service was good
La comida muy buena, mozos atentos. Pero las chicas de la entrada dejan mucho que desear, para nada atentas.
Excelente servicio la comida muy rica

The experience at PioPio was immaculate. The customer service was top tier. While walking to my table, there were men standing up looking around waiting to help anyone and everyone who needed assistance. The friendliness of this place is top tier. The food is to die for. Flavorful beyond and was cooked in such a great time as it was only about 15 minutes until we got our meal. I would recommend anyone in NY or that is visiting, to come on by; your tummies are waiting to be satisfied â˜ºï¸

Great lunch special
But no drinks happy hour

Fui hace unos aÃ±os fue exelente la atenciÃ³n y el ambiente. La comida exelente ğŸ‘Œ
Fui para Aniversario de Bodas
Les visitarÃ© en abril 2026
Un fuerte abrazo desde Puerto Rico ğŸ‡µğŸ‡·
Grateful. Great price. Great atmosphere. Great location? Nothing bad to say here will come again
Excelente atencion

It appears small from out side, but it extend to a decent sized dining area downstairs.
Excellent food. They have traditional dishes with a slight twist. Very delicious food.
Service is also very good.
Worst cutomer service experience i've had. Host and manager was unacommodating. And only speak spanish
The chicken at Pio Pio is so juicy..so tasty. So much food. Great place to eat and have cocktails.

Anticuchos  super delicioso rico el valor es modesto.
Parihuela
Y saltado muy rico!! La atenciÃ³n  es muy buena estÃ¡n pendiente  de cada cosa que necesitemos  se acaba el agua la.vuelve a llenar. Super todo.

I was very disappointed with my recent experience. I ordered the chicken chaufa and was surprised to see very little chicken in the dish, especially considering the $27 price. I usually visit the Queens location and have had good experiences there, but this time I went to the city location. When I called to raise my concern, I was asked to send a video to the manager, which I did, but unfortunately I never received a response or resolution. I found that lack of follow-up to be very unprofessiona! I will be posting a video of this
Their signature chicken was super dry n the Sal chi papas were dry yuck !!!
Me encanta!
Garlic sauce never disappoints!! Love this and all the other locations
One of the best peruvian restaurants that I've been to.

Restaurant tipicament peruÃ  al centre de Nova York, vam menjar molt bÃ©, perÃ² com que no teniem molta gana vam demanar poc menjar i el xef no li va agradar gaire. El menjar bonÃ­ssim i abundant. Recomenable
One of the best Lomo Saltado Iâ€™ve eaten. Great food and service. Nice area.

Really hyped, and with a lot of reviews, the expectations were high.

What was good?
When for starters the chicken was indeed quite good. But in the context of other Peruvian chicken Iâ€™ve had in the past, it was not extraordinary. Yes the skin was crispy and the meat was juicy. The arroz chaufa hit all the savory notes that I was looking for too. The sangria didnâ€™t disappoint either.

What was bad?
Overall, not too much other than the sporadic and slightly chaotic service. Not necessarily any marks against Pio Pio for this, I think it was just a busy night.

The main issue I had was the frozen chicken used in the arroz chaufa. In a restaurant that is known for its chicken, you wouldnâ€™t think they would cheap out on it at any point. But, this was simply not the case. It was dry, chewy, and clearly not as fresh as their rotisserie chicken.

It didnâ€™t scare me off entirely from going back, but I was disappointed to say the least. Most people have extremely low bars for chicken as a meat they would spend money on at a restaurant. Donâ€™t give people a reason to complain I just donâ€™t get it. Looking back on it, I would have said something or sent the dish back, not because Iâ€™m an asshole, but because I know they can do better.

Fui a ese restaurante por las valoraciones.
La atencion fue normal, pero la comida fue horrible, pedi causa rellena, lomo saltado y anticuchos. Me gaste 100 dolares por algo que no valio nada la pena. El lomo saltado estuvo muy seco, el arroz se salvo. La causa ni sabia a causa, fue muy pastosa y seca tambien. Los anticuchos no sÃ© quÃ© sazÃ³n tenian pero peruano no era. Siento que la comida peruana sea ahora tan cara y sea dificil encontrar un buen lugar. No recomendio a nadie comer ahÃ­, y no lo digo porque sea malo, sino porque como consumidor, nadie merece comer comida seca y mala llevandose asi una mala experiencia de la comida peruana. Sigo buscando un buen restaurante peruano en New York.

It was a great dining experience. The food was delicious. We had appetizers and two family-style combos that were more than enough for a big group of eight. The atmosphere was nice, but our server seemed a little inexperienced.
el mesero castroso que no dejaba de hablar y se queria hacer el â€œgraciosoâ€.
Peruvian to the max. Nice place to meet up for a bite improving drinks before after a theater show.
La srta que lleva a los clientes a la mesas no es tan amable
Excelente restaurante peruano a muy buen precio para NYC
The front door does not do what is inside justice. Very good fare. Artfully appointed dining on two levels.
Best combo of chicken with green sauce! (that Iâ€™ve tried so far). Nice drinks & location. Recommended if you are in the area.
Beautiful spot and the food was amazing
Always great , a visit all there location time to time , and they always deliver consistency in food and hospitality.  Best Ceviche in the world.
This place never disappoints. I've been coming to this location for over a decade, and it gets better just like fine wine.
Whenever my family and I are in the city, we try to swing by for Jalea and a Matador Combo. The chaufa is my personal favorite. Rating- A

Great place to spend some time over a meal with friends. I only wish the menu wasnâ€™t so safe; Peru has more interesting food than this! Staff was super kind with an excited child, very helpful and nice. Iâ€™ll be back, though if they had Cuy, Iâ€™d be back faster!
El mejor pollo del mundo
Absolutely amazing food, great service and the atmosphere is one of a kind!

Buena atenciÃ³n y comida deliciosa.
Super recomendado ğŸ¤—

Iâ€™ve been coming here for over 13 years and itâ€™s still one of my absolute favorites! The food is always fresh and delicious, and the service is consistently warm and welcoming. A true neighborhood gemâ€”highly recommend!
Good food, although admittedly not as flavorful as it used to be. Generous portions. Beautiful restaurant and fast, friendly service. It's a good option when you have to go way west.
Es lo peor en restaurante, la comida mala  y el pollo estaba crudo ,al personal le falta preparacion ,educacion ,jamas volvere hay
Amazing food! Good prices! Highly recommend it!
Delicious food and beautiful restaurant, very spacious but recommend reservation. The Lomo Saltado is amazing and the whole menu should be commended for its authenticity to Peruvian cuisine.
I have been here 4 years ago and food was better
Excellent food. Empanadas and lomo saltado were excellent. Generous portions

My piece of chicken in the lunch combo was super small, so it was kind of disappointing, but the chicken had great flavor. The air conditioning wasnâ€™t working, so it was very stuffy and uncomfortable inside the restaurant, and there was nothing they could do about it.

Very memorable dinner. We had a large party. The staff was beyond excellent. I canâ€™t mention a single negative point. The venue is stunning. The food was amazing and plentiful. Drinks were spot on perfect. The only pro tipâ€¦.I would be careful with ordering appetisersâ€¦. they were huge and absolutely deliciousâ€¦. made it difficult to finish my main course. ( but I did ğŸ«¢ğŸ˜Š) I highly recommend this restaurant!
OMG! Great spot for dinner. The food was very good. Had a good time with a buddy from HS and his family.

With numerous other locations and named of sound chicks make, this chain serves rotisserie chicken and other Peruvian dishes. The meal was very carb heavy, and a bit muted flavors other than desserts. Was not a big fan of the sausage and fries, the chicken was a bit dry but tasty.

This location is beautifully decorated and architecturally designed with the double height dining room, though our large party remained on the ground floor near the entrance.

Let me tell you something, there is not a better Peruvian Restaurant in New York than Pio Pio, Theyâ€™ve got multiple locations, but my favorite is the one with the City Vibes.
We ordered different options youâ€™ll see it all in my pics, food is so good and the homemade green and garlic sauce are fire ğŸ”¥
I always order the red wine sangria, we got the pitcher (3 glasses each). I believe the Chaufa rice and the small Jalea are perfect for two people and I still ended up with a bunch of leftovers to take home. Portions are super generous!
The service? Super nice. They were on top of everything, and the food came out fast and fresh.

Thanks for watch my review and please donâ€™t forget to follow my page for more!

The food is incredible! And the pisco sour is amazing. We visit this place every time weâ€™re in New York â˜ºï¸
The noise level is a bit on the higher side when you sit downstairs but itâ€™s not a huge issue.

We went there on a weekday night, and we didnâ€™t need to make a reservation or wait in line. The atmosphere was pleasant. The portions of the food were huge and tasty; we loved it. However, the main dish was a little over-seasoned. We ordered the fish with fried rice and half a chicken
Second time that we came here, always great food! My husband loves the chicken, I had a great ceviche and fried cassava. The green sauce is so good!

The hostess was very pleasant and welcoming. However, the manager had a very rude and unpleasant attitude. I had initially ordered my food to go, but less than four minutes later I asked if I could change it to dine in. Unfortunately, I was told I had to eat from the takeout container and sit outside. This was disappointing and reflected very poor customer service on the part of the manager, who, after all, represents the face of the restaurant. On a positive note, the food is always a 10 out of 10.

This was the perfect spot to eat dinner before our show. We were seated without waiting even without reservations. The service was fast friendly and professional. The food was delicious. We shared a ceviche mixto and the seafood was fresh and  tender served with the traditional crispy and boiled corn. My partner loved his Lomo Saltado and the beef was melt in your mouth tender! My chicken tamal didnâ€™t disappoint, with great flavor and texture. We added the plantains, prepared two different ways Tostines ( savory, smashed and crispy with delectable garlic sauce) and Maduros (sweet soft and delicious). Added some potent sangria for a great meal!

Surprising and amazing place with great food and service. Had the spicy seafood soup and the roasted chicken, both incredibly tasty and fresh, and the service was quick, courteous and above par. Would recommend unreservedly.
This is my all-time favorite! The chicken is so juicy and everything we ordered was absolutely delicious. Dessert made it extra special! Klever is awesome!

Fabulous food, especially ceviche. Meals served family style. No wonder we took part in 6 B'Day wishes coming from different tables in the matyer of only two hours :)
Great, timely service. I still dream of their Sangria.
Incredibly fresh seafood with generous portions! The roasted chicken is also amazing (Donâ€™t forget to ask for that green magic sauce). This seafood-loving Pacific Islander is super happy!

Itâ€™s our first time my family went to this place. Everything was perfect. Great server, Cesar.  We were in and out and made it to our Broadway show on time. Food was delicious  we had the seafood special, chicken , salad, and desert sampler.

Second time there and I have to say the place is great if you want good amounts of food and flavor. First time the limo saltado was medium done and so juicy, unfortunately the second time it wasnâ€™t as good. The arroz con mariscos was super good as usual, that plate is good enough for 2 people so be mindful.

Never disappointed by Peruvian food! The seabass will never go wrong, the rice that came with it has good texture and flavor. The seafood stew was amaaaazing! The sauce goes so well with the rice! The serving size was so big,  wish we didnâ€™t order the appetizer. The chicha morada (sweet purple corn beverage) is a must have.

We had a party of 23 people. They were accommodating to set up a few long tables to seat all of us. Just want people to know that my reviews are unbiased and based on my actual food tastes experience. Some of the dishes were good. The popular rotisserie chicken was somewhat dry and salty. Sweet plantain appetizer wasn't as sweet as expected. Overall, some of the dishes were satisfying. The service was great! And the waiter advised us that the total bill already included 20% tips for a large party group.ğŸ‘

Service was excellent. The food was great. Spicy hot and delicious. Unfortunately, the fish in one of the dishes was not fresh. The restaurant offered a replacement. However....I would be cautious from now on.

Pio Pio 8, a Peruvian restaurant located in the heart of Manhattan, has always been one of my favorite spots for its authentic and delicious cuisine. The ceviche is fresh and flavorful.

However, my recent visit left much to be desired in terms of service quality. From the moment I arrived, the staff seemed eager to rush me through the dining experience. They hurried me to place my order and later pressed me to settle the bill quickly. This created an uncomfortable atmosphere, making me feel like I was an inconvenience rather than a valued customer. Despite arriving late, I expected the same level of courtesy and attentiveness that other patrons received.

Additionally, the restroom was quite uncomfortable and lacked a mirror, which added to the overall negative experience. It's crucial for a restaurant to balance efficiency with hospitality, ensuring that all customers feel welcome and valued, regardless of their arrival time. I hope Pio Pio 8 can address these service issues, as it has the potential to provide an exceptional dining experience consistently.
